The history of mankind can
be traced from full grain crops,
through famines to bread strikes.
More writer's have added poetic
phra ses about loaves of bread
than one can imagine.


Biblical reference to mamma
bread and wheat and grain are
numerous. Bread has been lab
eled the staff of life. Bread is
symbolic with full stoma chs, good
harvests, heaping plates and asty
foods.


Every nation has a national
bread which serves a S the basic
food. The bread may be black,
brown, yellow or white. 1t may
be ia shioned from corn, wheat,
rice or even barley.


No matter where you go--north
south, ca st or west - there's
some bread cooking somewhere.
Some like it hot, some like it
cold, some like it long, some like
it round, some like it fried,
some it baked and some like 1t
day old.


Writer'S have made catchy
phra ses which have survived
some of their important works.
We recall the religious meaning
inferred when bread wa S broken
for different communions or holy
affairs.
